text: Dan Kohn (November 20, 1972November 1, 2020) was an American businessman and nonprofit executive. He led the Linux Foundationâ€™s Public Health initiative. He was formerly the executive director at Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF). He was the founder of NetMarket, which he founded in 1994. Kohn died of problems caused by colon cancer on November 1, 2020 at the age of 47. ==References== Category:1972 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from colorectal cancer Category:Businesspeople from New York City
title: Dan Kohn
